author: Marlena Francisco
comment: Why do you need detailed personal information such as my addresss? Too invasive of a innocuous device. Convenience only gets you so much access.

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: Hi there, the app you left a review for does NOT collect any personal information. You are referring to the official Iris by Lowes app and the service which collects that information. Iris+ you are reviewing is a third party application meant to expand the features of service provided by Lowes.

author: Jason Bogdanowicz-Wilson
comment: Pretty useless compared to the first generation.  They are pretty much trying to force you into a subscription service.  You should at least have the same functionality in your phone and you do with the online login.  You have zero control over your thermostats schedule from your phone , unless you get premium.

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: Hi there. I believe you meant to review the official Lowes app based on your comment. Iris+ is an independent app that expands on the official functionality provided by Lowes and is not affiliated with or has any input on services provided by Lowes or Iris team.

author: Ray Shealy
comment: What does this ap even do, I have almost not functionality at all. And I paid 9.99 for nothing wth?

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: For functionality description please read the description on the app store - it has plenty of details. The app does require having Iris by Lowes system. If you are not happy just send your play store receipt to support@80degreeswest.com for a refund.

author: Irving Mancao
comment: Thank you.  Made iris integration better

author: McDonald Parker
comment: Great app

author: Jason Wenzel
comment: Great work, good supplement to Iris. Especially with ITTT integration

author: Cody Fyler
comment: Fixed. Works great again!!!

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: There was a change on Iris backend within the last week that broke Iris+. Because there is no official API any changes by Lowes may take time to figure out and troubleshoot. v3.5 coming out today will have the fix.

author: Edwin Hall
comment: Great interface

author: Merv Medina
comment: The only thing extra you get for paid version is longer activities report.

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: Also advance status, extra notifications, using phone as keyfob, IFTTT integration, advance hub information, android wear app and widgets none of which are supported in the free or official Iris app.

comment: I wish it would come back.  I miss it.

author: Jeremy Cunningham
comment: It doesn't lose credentials like the Lowe's app!
title: Glad I Found It!

author: Jason Gerner
comment: I like this better that the Lowe's app. I really like the widget feature.
title: Iris

author: Dan Hendricks
comment: Better then Lowes app

author: Lisa Morales
comment: In this app it says I have no thermostat, but I have one connected. Also, do you have any instructions anywhere? How do I add a mobile device as a presence sensor? How do I run IFTTT?

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: You can access tutorials by clicking on the question mark icon at the top. Also here: http://80degreeswest.com/apps/irisplus/help.php. For thermostat issue, try log out and log back in. If problem persists, enable debug mode in settings, visit Thermostat screen and use Send Logs button so that I can troubleshoot it.

title: Some problems

comment: For everyone complaining about this app,  it may be the only good thing to happen to this system.  I can actually troubleshoot my issues with actual data and not repetitive YouTube videos and a 3 hour wait for customer service.   I have not been able to get root access to the hub but this is for next best thing to actually making it work
title: Outstanding

author: Bob D.
comment: Very limited in what you can do unless you pay. Can't even view the device list let alone do anything with it. Can't test rule or scene creation and other features that will surely make this app a must have.

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: The update has not hit the Play Store when you tried it. v3.0 should be available now for you to try.

author: Bill Anderson
comment: Needs work.
title: It needs work

author: Eric P.
comment: I have no issues with the Lowe's Iris app. This app just showed up when I searched for it so I gave it a go. It's okay. Clunky interface. Nuts and bolts. No material design. It's not something I expect from Lowe's, but I do from an independent dev. Not an elegant solution by any means. The Lowe's app is, however, and it's free. Uninstalled for now. Reply from devs shows class and gives me hope for a great Lowe's app alternative.

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback! Main effort was on the advanced features that the Lowes app does not offer - using mobile phones for presence, IFTTT integration, etc. The interface redesign, however, is on the roadmap.

title: Premium Features Not Compelling for $9.99

author: Estevan Apodaca
comment: I am very impressed with this app it actually loads faster than the Iris has no delay when turning on and off the light and its Android wear compatible I will be purchasing the premium later
title: Love it

author: Jim Crisanti
comment: So much more info than the stock app

author: Rafe Barber
comment: Developer is very responsive with hunting and squashing bugs!  *** 10/8/16 - Awesome update! It now works with older Android versions!
title: Cool beans!

author: Jeffrey Allen
comment: This app does what I have wanted for a very long time. It allows me to put widgets on my home screen to turn lights on and off. Thank you, thank you, thank you.
title: Widgets!

author: Charles Menk
comment: Got the app because it had  greet history. Why did you remove  it --- mistake-NOT.  They have it. Be sure the 'setup' is has the features enabled. Thank You😃

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: There have been no changes related to history in any of the past releases. If you are not seeing history, please try force stopping the app, restarting your phone and if you are still having issues, uninstall and reinstall the app. If this still does not fix your issue, please enable logs, navigate to history and then use the send logs option.

title: No history!!!  IT'S THERE --YEA

author: bizsinzen
comment: I will miss this one it is nice to have a more simplified version to use without all the lag issues of Lowes version.
title: Better than the APP from Lowes!

author: Jeff Gallagher
comment: Beats the Lowes official app. Hopefully the developer will upgrade to the 2.0 hub.
title: Good App

author: Morgan Aune
comment: Are you going to support 2.0?

author: Shawn B
comment: I don't like that i can't lock out the security controls from the dashboard.  I like to leave all other controls available without having to enter a pin every time.  Anyone could break into my house and disable the alarm from any of my tablets. I can lock it out from the menu, but not dashboard. Fix this and i will give 5 stars

reply.author: 80 Degrees West, LLC
reply.content: If you set a Pin in settings, you will be required to enter that pin any time you open the app. So if someone gets a hold of your phone they would need a pin to go to any screen including the dashboard. Hope this helps.

title: Almost perfect

author: LPOwilliams
comment: Are you planning on adding ability for the 2.0 iris hub.?
title: Like this app.

author: Donna Mellow
comment: Only issue I have is when it updates the site is a bit funky for a few days.
title: It's good

author: augustine luna
comment: Really easy to use
title: Better then the lows app

author: Paul Brzezinski
comment: Works good!

author: heike braxton
comment: Better than the IRIS app.
title: Love it.

author: Jesse McCulley
comment: Very good program.
title: Loved it

author: Mike Hickman
comment: Great!

author: David greenseeker
comment: Works great

author: Mike Leitzel
comment: Much faster than the Lowes app and the integration with ifttt is fun. Keep up the great work!
title: Wonderful

author: Doug Glaze
comment: Nobody's forgetting to arm the system anymore!
title: Well done

author: Anthony Raynor
comment: I'm a newer user of the Lowe's Iris system.  The stock app is decent,  but it lacks some customization. Iris+ allow for more functions,  customization and even voice control in the paid app.
title: Appreciate the effort

author: Scott Garcia
comment: Alot easier to navigate.
title: Garcia

author: Patrick Pai
comment: Very nice app for Lowe's iris smart home
title: Iris+
